00024 #ifndef _UNIT_HPP_
00025 #define _UNIT_HPP_
00026 
00027 
00028 #include <string>
00029 #include <sstream>
00030 #include <stdexcept>
00031 #include <cmath>
00032 
00033 
00034 namespace pwiz {
00035 namespace util {
00036 
00037 
00038 //
00039 // These are assertion macros for unit testing.  They throw a runtime_error 
00040 // exception on failure, instead of calling abort(), allowing the application
00041 // to recover and return an appropriate error value to the shell.
00042 //
00043 // unit_assert(x):                             asserts x is true
00044 // unit_assert_equal(x, y, epsilon):           asserts x==y, within epsilon
00045 // unit_assert_matrices_equal(A, B, epsilon):  asserts A==B, within epsilon
00046 //
00047 
00048 
00049 inline std::string unit_assert_message(const char* filename, int line, const char* expression)
00050 {
00051     std::ostringstream oss;
00052     oss << "[" << filename << ":" << line << "] Assertion failed: " << expression; 
00053     return oss.str();
00054 }
00055 
00056 
00057 #define unit_assert(x) \
00058     (!(x) ? throw std::runtime_error(unit_assert_message(__FILE__, __LINE__, #x)) : 0) 
00059 
00060 
00061 #define unit_assert_equal(x, y, epsilon) \
00062     unit_assert(fabs((x)-(y)) < (epsilon))
00063 
00064 
00065 #define unit_assert_matrices_equal(A, B, epsilon) \
00066     unit_assert(boost::numeric::ublas::norm_frobenius((A)-(B)) < (epsilon))
00067 
00068 
00069 #define unit_assert_vectors_equal(A, B, epsilon) \
00070     unit_assert(boost::numeric::ublas::norm_2((A)-(B)) < (epsilon))
00071 
00072 
00073 } // namespace util
00074 } // namespace pwiz
00075 
00076 
00077 #endif // _UNIT_HPP_
